result.execSummary:
The defendant Staisha L Binns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Soliciting a Child for Prostitution [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.08.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay applicable costs, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge and assessments; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant. Court costs and surcharges be paid through collection by the department of corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Restitution set at ZERO. Pay all supervision fees.

07-30-15/ David Borowski
The Court ordered the sentence modified as follows:
Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT OF 7 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence;  the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5.5 years.  Department of Corrections to determine sentence credit.
Court also modified condition of No Contact with Glendale to No Contact with hotels and motels on Port Washington Rd between Capitol Dr and Hampton Ave.
Consecutive to: any other sentence with credit for 63 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain GED/HSED.
Seek/maintain full time employment.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firaerm possession; voting.

No further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No contact with the victim, victims residence or school, victims family, the City of Glendale, Port Washington Road or any Hotels on Port Washington Road.

Attend and complete a parenting class.
Mental Health evaluation and take all prescribed medication.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens (at least once per month).
Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
Register and comply with the sex offender registry.
Obtain/comply with sex offender treatment.
Provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay surcharge.
If defendant cooperates with authorities regarding the co-actors (specifically the male co-actor) in this matter, the court will allow a motion to modify the sentencing.
AODA assessment and comply with any treatment

Reflects 07-30-15 Court order amending sentence to 7 yrs total & modifying NO Contact with Glendale order.

Attorney Michelle Lee Velasquez in court, defendant Staisha L Binns not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant not produced.    Hearing on motion to modify sentence proceeded.  Statements made by counsel. 

Court ordered sentence modified as follows:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5.5 YEARS.  Department of Corrections to determine sentence credit.

Court also modified condition of No contact with Glendale to No contact with hotels and motels on Port Washington Road beween Capitol Drive and Hampton Ave.

Attorney Velasquez to submit order.

Attorney Michelle Lee Velasquez in court, defendant Staisha L Binns not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing to modify sentence in Branch 12.  Motion hearing scheduled for 07-30-2015 at 02:30 pm.
Court of Appeals order dated June 10, 2015, Appeal 2014XX1268CR, the deadline for the circuit court to decide the post-conviction motion is extended to August 7, 2015.

Defendant Staisha L Binns in court with attorney Michelle Lee Velasquez.  Defendant Staisha L Binns in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Hearing proceeded on Defense Motion to Modify Sentence.  The Court held an off the record conversation with counsel in chambers.  For the reasons as stated on the record, Court modified the portion of the extended supervision regarding the no contact with the City of Glendale, Port Washington Road or any Hotels on Port Washington Road TO NOW READ: NO CONTACT WITH ANY HOTELS OR MOTELS ON PORT WASHINGTON ROAD, BETWEEN CAPITOL DRIVE AND SILVER SPRING, NORTH OF GOOD HOPE.  

Court ordered case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 12 on 6-17-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Defendant's appearance would not be required on the next date.  Defense counsel will be requesting an extension through the Court of Appeals.  mld

records.addlTxt:
AS TO COUNT 2 OF THE AMENDED INFORMATION - 
  On motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read in.

Defendant Staisha L Binns in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Staisha L Binns in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for plea hearing.  Discussion regarding plea negotiations.    Amended Information filed previously.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant wishes to plead guilty.
AS TO COUNT 1 of the AMENDED INFORMATION - 
Defendant sworn in. 
The defendant was advised of her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting.
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  
Court vacated the final pretrial on 5/2/2014 and jury trial on 6/9/2014.  
Case adjourned to Branch 12.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-15-2014 at 08:30 am.

Amended Information received and filed. Reflecting the following charges:
COUNT 1 -   Soliciting a Child for Prostitution, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.08, 939.50(3)(d) , a Class D Felony. 
COUNT 2 -   Physical Abuse of A Child (Intentional Causation of Bodily Harm), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(2)(b), 939.50(3)(h) , a Class H Felony. 
  Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Court orders cash bail to remain at $5,000.00.
Case is adjourned to Br. 12.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Staisha L Binns in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Staisha L Binns in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.
